|access-date=July 18, 2024}} known professionally as '''Ella Langley''', is an American [[country music]] singer-songwriter from [[Hope Hull, Alabama]] signed to [[Sony Music Nashville]] and [[Columbia Records]].{{cite web|url=https://ellalangley.com/about|title=About ‚Äî Ella Langley|website=Ella Langley|access-date=July 17, 2024}}{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2023/02/sony-music-nashville-signs-ella-langley/|title=Sony Music Nashville Signs Ella Langley|author=LB Cantrell|date=February 24, 2024|website=Music Row|access-date=July 17, 2024}} ==Background== Langley was born in [[Hope Hull, Alabama]] and performed locally at bars and festivals until relocating to Nashville in 2019. Langley has released a string of promotional singles, toured as an opening act for several high-profile country artists, and landed several cuts as a songwriter including five tracks on [[Elle King]]'s ''[[Come Get Your Wife]]'' and [[Runaway June]]'s "Make Me Wanna Smoke".{{cite web|url=https://americansongwriter.com/runaway-june-releases-fiery-new-anthem-make-me-wanna-smoke/|title=Runaway June Releases Fiery New Anthem "Make Me Wanna Smoke"|author=Lisa Konicki|date=May 20, 2023|website=[[American Songwriter]]|access-date=July 17, 2024}} In February 2023, it was announced that Langley had signed a record deal with [[Sony Music Nashville]] and [[Columbia Records]], and she made her [[Grand Ole Opry]] debut on February 17, 2023.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4rOuPac59dA|title=Ella Langley ‚Äî My Opry Debut|date=March 23, 2023|website=[[YouTube]]|access-date=July 17, 2024}}{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/JameyJohnson/posts/it-was-an-honor-to-introduce-ella-langley-music-at-her-grand-ole-opry-debut-this/902200727937830/|title=It was an honor to introduce Ella Langley Music at her Grand Ole Opry debut this past Friday.|author=[[Jamey Johnson]]|date=February 19, 2023|website=[[Facebook]]|access-date=July 17, 2024}} She released her debut EP, ''Excuse the Mess'', on May 19, 2023. Langley also recorded a duet with [[Kameron Marlowe]], "Strangers", which was released as the lead single from Marlowe's second studio album, ''Keepin' the Lights On''. Langley's full-length debut studio album, ''[[Hungover (album)|Hungover]]'', was released on August 2, 2024. Several promotional singles were released ahead of the album, including "[[You Look Like You Love Me]]", which features [[Riley Green (singer)|Riley Green]]. It became her first entry on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], debuting at number 53.{{cite magazine |last1=Zellner |first1=Xander |title=Hot 100 First-Timers: Ella Langley Scores First Entry With Riley Green Duet 'You Look Like You Love Me' |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/ella-langley-hot-100-debut-you-look-like-you-love-me-1235723166/ |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |access-date=July 6, 2024 |date=July 17, 2024}} It was released as Langley's debut single to country radio on August 5, 2024.{{cite tweet|user=USRadioUpdater|number=1819448854024253730|title="You Look Like You Love Me" by @ellalangleymsic ft. @RileyGreenMusic is now going for immediate airplay at US Country Radio (via #NashvilleHarbor).
